meanings.definition: To discharge or excrete waste material from the body.
meanings.sent1: After eating, the body starts egesting food waste.
meanings.sent2: Birds egest through their cloaca to remove waste.
meanings.sent3: The digestive system's job is egesting what the body doesn't need.
meanings.sent4: The river egests its pollutants into the ocean, harming marine life.
meanings.sent5: The garbage truck egests its load at the landfill, creating a mountain of trash.

meanings.definition: To expel or remove something from a confined space.
meanings.sent1: The magician egested a rabbit from his hat during the show.
meanings.sent2: She egested a sigh of relief after finishing her exam.
meanings.sent3: The crowded elevator egested passengers as it reached each floor.
meanings.sent4: The volcano egested ash and smoke into the sky, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing closet egested clothes every time it was opened, creating a mess.
